results.title: John Miles: drafted Vietnam
results.brief_description: John Miles recalls the 29th of September 1965 as the date that he commenced his National Service. While he was away, the political climate changed dramatically in Australia. Miles remembers his experience of the Vietnam War and his struggles once home in Australia. Miles’ treatment on return to Australia initially made left him feeling bitter, but a trip back to Vietnam was crucial to his personal transformation and healing.
results.description: John Miles recalls the 29th of September 1965 as the date that he commenced his National Service. While he was away, the political climate changed dramatically in Australia. results.title: An interview with Patrick Bourke
results.brief_description: Patrick Bourke was 16 when he grew onions with his father. Wanting to get out of this, he decided to join the navy. After convincing his father, he started work on his first ship H.M.A.S Adele, sighting subs and signalling wherever he was. Patrick retells some of his tales out at sea.

group_siblings.title: The Very last thing from Pandora's Box

results.title: Miss Navy
results.creator_credit: Margaret Morton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Margaret Morton’s first time in the navy was short lived, as she contracted pneumonia which further developed into tuberculosis, just six months after joining. This meant Margaret spent an extended period of time hospitalised and in isolation, an experience she found frustrating and lonely. Morton describes the memories she still holds dear from her short time in service.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Morton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Land Before Time
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Gary Goldman, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The land before time is an animated tale of dinosaurs who long ago roamed the land that was threatened by earthquakes and volcanoes. A young brontosaurus named Littlefoot sets off in search of the legendary Great Valley where dinosaurs can thrive and live in peace. Along the way he makes friends with four other dinosaurs. During their journey they encounter incredible adventures and obstacles and learn unforgettable lessons about life and what it means to stick together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Gary Goldman, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
